PerformanceTimeOrigin.summary: The timeOrigin read-only property of the interface returns the high resolution timestamp that is used as the baseline for performance-related timestamps.

remarks.para: In Window contexts, this value represents the time when navigation has started. In and contexts, this value represents the time when the worker is run. You can use this property to synchronize the time origins between the contexts (see example below).

blockquote.para: Note: The value of performance.timeOrigin may differ from the value returned by executed at the time origin, because Date.now() may have been impacted by system and user clock adjustments, clock skew, etc. The timeOrigin property is a monotonic clock which current time never decreases and which isn't subject to these adjustments.

PerformanceTimeOrigin.value: A high resolution timestamp which considered to be the beginning of the current document's lifetime. It's calculated like this:
